____________ maria joffee city clerk preface this a complete recodification of the general and permanent ordinances of the city of hialeah gardens florida source materials used in the preparation of the the 1985 as supplemented  and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city council the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1985 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state law have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this system the chapter and section numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of chapter 1 is numbered 12 and the first section of chapter 6 is 61 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 61 and 62 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 615 new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division new chapters may be included by using one of the reserved chapter numbers care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters page numbering system the page numbering system used in this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes charter cht1 charter comparative table chtct1 code cd code comparative tables cct1 state law reference table slt1 charter index chti1 code index cdi1 indexes the indexes have been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the indexes themselves which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept uptodate subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the affected page or pages will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication uptodate at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised pages are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of alyce a whitson supervising editor and charles vignos editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to charles blazek city clerk and neil flaxman city attorney for their cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that their efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys affairs copyright all editorial enhancements of this copyrighted by municipal the city of hialeah gardens and code of the city of hialeah gardens attached hereto as exhibit a excepting however provisions related to land use regulation and licensing  providing for severability  providing for effective date whereas the city of hialeah gardens charter and been codified in accordance with certain charter amendments that have been adopted and ordinances which have been amended  and whereas attached hereto and made a part hereof is a true copy of the codification of said   and whereas with the exception of the land use regulations and the licensing provisions contained in said the city of hialeah gardens desires to accept said charter and be the charter and the city of hialeah gardens  now therefore be it ordained by the mayor and the city council of the city of hialeah gardens florida as follows the city of hialeah gardens does hereby accept approve and adopt the charter and as prepared by municipal as attached hereto as exhibit a and made a part hereof as if fully set forth herein with the exception of the chapter referred to as land use regulations and licensing the ordinances of the city of hialeah gardens as it relates to land use regulations and licensing together with codification of such ordinances in prior codes be and the same is hereby accepted approved and adopted should any section paragraph sentence phrase clause or other part or provision of this ordinance be declared by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unconstitutional the same shall not affect the validity of the ordinance as a whole or any part thereof other than the one part so declared to be invalid this ordinance shall become effective upon its adoption in accordance with law passed and adopted this 4 th day of january 2000 attest _____ charles blazek city clerk _____ alvarez yes yes lucy valdes absent yes fatima r morejon yes yes approved as to form and sufficiency city attorney part i  charter footnotes  1  editors note printed herein is the charter of the city of hialeah gardens florida as adopted by referendum on  amendments to the charter are indicated by parenthetical history notes following amended provisions the absence of a history note indicates that the provision remains unchanged from the original charter obvious misspellings have been corrected without notation for stylistic purposes a uniform system of headings catchlines and citations to state statutes has been used additions made for clarity are indicated by brackets state law reference municipal home rule powers fs ch 166 article i  incorporation name the present government existing under the name of city of hialeah gardens shall continue to exist and shall continue to be known as city of hialeah gardens charter to prevail this charter adopted by the electors of the city of hialeah gardens shall supersede all previous charters and incorporate all provisions of the previous charters of the city of hialeah gardens which are not embraced herein and which are not inconsistent with this charter and which shall become ordinances of the city of hialeah gardens subject to modification or repeal in the same manner as other ordinances of the city this charter being adopted pursuant to the constitution of the state of florida and fs ch 166 eff  and amended shall supersede all general laws of the state of florida under which the city was heretofore organized existence and boundaries the municipal corporation for which this charter is adopted shall be known as the city of hialeah gardens the inhabitants of which shall be and constitute a body corporate and politic with perpetual existence within the boundaries and territorial limits of the county of dade state of florida as follows all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal all that part of south 40 east lying north and east from the center line of the miami canal less the north 330 feet of said section city of hialeah gardens the procedures for adjusting the boundaries of hialeah gardens or contractions of its corporate limits will be as prescribed by fs ch 171 as amended state law reference municipalities adopt annexation ordinances pursuant to the dade county charter fs   powers of the municipality a the city of hialeah gardens shall have governmental corporate and proprietary powers to enable it to conduct municipal government perform municipal functions and render municipal services and may exercise any power for municipal purposes except where expressly prohibited by law b the powers of the city of hialeah gardens shall be construed liberally in favor of the city limited only by the state constitution general law the dade county charter and specific limitations contained herein through the adoption of this charter it is the intent of the electors of the city of hialeah gardens to grant the broadest exercise of home rule powers permitted under the state constitution and state law to the municipal government established herein state law reference home rule powers fs   article ii  succession succession of rights this municipality shall succeed to the title rights and ownership of property uncollected taxes claims judgments decrees and choses in action including any and all property rights personal or mixed of any nature whatsoever held or owned by the city prior to the adoption of this charter all of which shall pass to and be vested in the city under this charter continuance of contractual obligations this charter shall not be construed in any manner to impair any obligations or contracts debts or obligations heretofore binding upon the city and the same shall continue to be binding on the city under this charter pending matters all rights claims actions orders contracts and legal or administrative proceedings involving the city shall continue except as modified pursuant to the provisions of this charter ordinances and resolutions preserved all ordinances and resolutions in effect upon the adoption of this charter to the extent not inconsistent with it shall remain in force until repealed or changed as provided herein article iii  government form of government the form of government of the city of hialeah gardens florida provided for under this charter shall be known as the mayorcouncil form of government all legislative powers of the city shall be vested in the city council all executive powers of the city shall be vested in the mayor the council shall consist of five 5 citizens who are qualified voters of the city and who shall hold no other elective public office and who shall be elected in a manner hereinafter provided  the individual council members shall have one 1 vote in all matters before the city council the mayor shall be a qualified voter of the city and shall hold no other elective public office and shall be elected in a manner hereinafter provided  in the event of a tie vote by the members of the city council the issue shall be considered defeated  however the mayor shall have the right at his discretion to call a special council meeting within ten 10 days to reconsider this particular issue in the event a vacancy exists in the council the mayor shall have the right to cast one 1 tiebreaking vote powers of the city council a the city council shall constitute the governing body of the city with all governmental corporate and proprietary powers of the city of hialeah gardens the council shall have the power to pass ordinances resolutions and to adopt regulations to enable it to conduct municipal government perform municipal functions and to render municipal services b the city council shall be the legislative and governing body of the city with the assistance of such officers servants agents and employees as may be deemed necessary the council shall by resolution provide for and set the compensation of all employees each member of the city council may appoint to any board or committee one 1 member who is a registered voter of the city of hialeah gardens or is the proprietor of an established business in the city of hialeah gardens to serve at the discretion of the council without compensation with such duties as provided by resolution as the council may deem necessary c the city council shall elect by majority vote from within itself a chairperson a vicechairperson and a financial director at the organizational meeting following each election state law reference municipal home rule powers fs ch 166 powers of the mayor a the mayor shall constitute the executive head of the city with all the necessary powers and authority to enforce all laws ordinances and resolutions of the city council b the mayor shall be recognized as the official head of the city for all ceremonial purposes by the courts for the purpose of serving civil process and by the governor for all military or civil defense purposes in time of public danger or emergency the mayor with the consent of the city council may take command of the police to maintain order and enforce the laws c during the mayors absence or disability the duties of mayor shall be performed by the chairperson of the city council d the mayor shall be responsible for the preparation of an annual budget in a manner hereinafter provided  e the mayor shall advise the city council as to the needs of the city it shall be the duty of the mayor to keep the city council well informed as to the financial condition of the city f the mayor may appoint to any board or committee with the exception of the zoning board two 2 members to serve at the discretion of the council without compensation with such duties as provided by resolution as the council may deem necessary g the mayor shall be responsible for the day to day operation of the city by overseeing all city departments h the mayor shall have the right and the responsibility to appoint and remove all officers servants agents and employees of the city without the right of veto by the council in the event of demotion suspension or discharge of an employee the employee with written notice is entitled to appeal to the personnel review board subject to the rules and regulations thereof i the mayor shall attend meetings of the city council with the right to take part in discussion on all matters before the council but not to vote except as heretofore provided  j the mayor shall perform such duties as may be prescribed by the charter ordinances or resolutions of the city council k the mayor shall have the right and responsibility to appoint and remove all officers servants agents and employees of editors note superseded and replaced affected the same portion of this charter art iii  6a as but was never voted upon and was therefore omitted from notation within this   supervisor of city elections a every municipal election shall be conducted by and be under the personal supervision of the city clerk who is hereby empowered and directed to exercise all of the powers and to perform all of the duties and functions appropriate to the conduct of such election including the establishment promulgation and enforcement of such rules and regulations relating to such election and the establishment maintenance filing and preservation of such election records as the city clerk may deem necessary or which may be required by city county or state law b prior to each municipal election the mayor shall designate a clerk of election and one inspector of election and each council member shall appoint one inspector of election and the names of such clerks and inspectors shall be published by posting at city hall all persons who shall serve as clerks of election or as inspectors of election at any municipal election held in the city shall have the status of casual and temporary employees not entitled to the status or to any of the rights or benefits of regular or permanent city employees judge of city elections the city council shall be the judge of all city elections and the qualifications of all applicants for all elected city offices election of city officials and terms of office a the office of mayor shall be a nonpartisan office the mayor shall be elected by a majority vote of the citys electorate all candidates seeking the office of mayor shall file to run in group i all qualified candidates names shall be placed on the general elections ballot the names of the two candidates receiving the highest number of votes shall be placed on the runoff elections ballot except if one candidate received a clear majority vote at the general election in which case the candidate receiving the majority vote would be declared mayorelect the candidate receiving the majority vote at the runoff election shall be declared mayorelect b the mayor group i shall be elected at the citys runoff election in 198 and thereafter shall be elected each odd numbered year for a four 4 year term of office editors note res no 224  2 adopted mar 18 2008 set out provisions affecting that the term of office of the mayor be extended from a twoyear term to a fouryear term commencing with the mayoral election to be held on mar 6 1997 election for said provisions was held on sept 3 1996 c the five 5 seats that make up the city council shall be nonpartisan offices the five 5 members of the city council shall be elected at large by a majority vote of the citys electorate all candidates seeking a seat on the city council shall file to run in any one 1 of the five 5 groups that represent the five 5 city council seats group ii group iii group iv group v or group vi all qualified candidates filing for the same group shall have their names placed together on the general elections ballot there shall be as many separate groups as there are seats on the council open for election the names of the two candidates receiving the highest number of votes in each group shall be placed on the runoff elections ballot except if one candidate received a clear majority vote over the other candidates in the group at the general election in that case the candidate receiving the majority vote would be declared councilmemberelect in that group the candidate receiving the highest number of votes at the runoff election shall be declared councilmemberelect in that group d commencing with the election in march 199 all council groups shall serve a four year term with one seat continuing to be two years editors note  adopted feb 3 199 set out provisions to implement  d as follows that all councilpersons elected at the next election  shall serve for a period of four years and at councilpersons elections after  all councilpersons term of office shall be for four years with the councilperson who receives the least votes in such election to serve for a two year term e the citys council members in groups ii iii and iv shall be elected at the citys general or runoff election in 1981 the citys council members in groups v and vi shall be elected at the citys primary or runoff election in 1982 f all elected city officials mayor and city council members shall remain in office until their successors are elected and sworn into office g any incumbent city council member seeking the office of mayor group i shall submit a written resignation to the city clerk not less than ninety 90 days prior to the date of the citys runoff election and said resignation shall become effective on the date of the runoff election upon receipt of a written resignation the city clerk shall make a public announcement of the resignation and will accept candidates to run for election to the remaining unexpired term of the city council members seat h any elected city official mayor or city council member seeking some other elective public office outside the city shall submit a written resignation to the city clerk upon qualifying for the other elective public office should the city official refuse or fail to submit a written resignation upon qualifying for another elective public office the official shall be ousted from office and the office shall be declared vacant i any elected official mayor or city council member who no longer remains a resident and qualified elector of the city during their term in office shall submit a written resignation to the city clerk should the city official refuse or fail to submit a written resignation the official shall be ousted from office immediately and the office shall be declared vacant j the mayor shall serve full time during regular city hall business hours to fulfill the mayoral powers such mayoral service shall be the mayors only full time employment referendum 3387   1220913392   1220913392   117953795   115963497   2398  res no 224 31808 recall of an elected city official the mayor or any member of the city council may be removed from office by the citys electorate in accordance with the recall procedure as established by fs   should the florida state legislature amend or adopt a new statute establishing recall proceedings then the amended or new statute shall automatically be adopted by this section of the hialeah gardens city charter state law reference recall of elected officials fs   standards of conduct for city officials and employees a the standards of conduct for city officials both elected and nonelected servants agents and other employees shall be in accordance with the standards of conduct law fs   et seq and as amended b no member of the immediate family of the mayor and no member of the immediate family of a city council member shall be chosen as the city clerk or to any other city office or employment further this charter adopts all the provisions of fs   state law reference ethics fs   et seq rules for the city council a should any elected official of the city fail to attend three 3 consecutive city council meetings the elected official shall be considered to have resigned the office however illness absence from the city or other reasonable excuse may be offered in writing for purposes of record by the elected official to the city council if such be accepted by the city council this provision shall not be invoked b a minimum of three 3 members of the city council shall constitute a quorum to do city business c a minimum of three 3 affirmative votes is necessary for the city council to act on any matter brought before the council d the city council may determine its own rules of procedure and may punish its own members for misconduct e the latest published and released edition of roberts rules of order shall be the official parliamentary guide for all meetings of the city council when it is not in conflict with the charter or other rules adopted by the city council f all motions to be voted on by the city council at a regular or special meeting must be pertinent to the items on the official agenda for that specific city council meeting this requirement may be waived by the unanimous consent of the city council in order to conduct matters of an emergency nature g fortyeight 48 hours after the close of the polls on the date of the citys runoff election the city council shall meet in the council chambers of the city for the purpose of swearing in the newly elected city officials thereafter the city council shall meet at such time and place as shall be prescribed by resolution of the city council h all meetings of the city council and all sessions of any board or committee of the city shall be public i no member of the city council shall be excused from voting except on matters involving the consideration of his or her own official conduct or where his or her financial interests are involved referendum 3387 state law reference voting conflicts fs   manner of passage of ordinances a all ordinances except concerning appropriations or budget shall be confined to one subject which shall be clearly expressed in the title any ordinance concerning appropriations or budget shall be confined to the subject of appropriations or budget b no ordinance shall be passed until it has been read into the public record by title or in full on two separate occasions separated by at least a period of twentyfour 24 hours ordinances shall be read by title only unless a motion to read an ordinance in its entirety is duly made and seconded and at least twothirds of the council members present agree to the reading in its entirety c copies of all proposed ordinances shall be furnished to each council member and the mayor at least seven 7 days before the first reading of the ordinance this requirement may be waived by a unanimous consent of the city council copies of all proposed ordinances shall be made available to all interested persons at city hall during normal business hours d the yes and no votes of the city council members shall be taken and placed into the public record on the consideration of all ordinances every ordinance shall require on each reading a minimum of three 3 affirmative votes for passage e all ordinances passed by the city council shall be submitted before going into effect to the mayor or person acting as such for his approval if approved he shall sign the same when it shall become a law if vetoed he shall return the same with his objections in writing to the city council at their next regular meeting who shall cause the same to be entered in full upon the record of their proceedings and proceed to consider the mayors objections and to act upon the same if upon consideration the city council shall pass the same by a twothirds vote of the members present which vote shall be entered upon the records the ordinance or ordinances shall then become a law the mayors objections to the contrary notwithstanding any ordinance which shall not be returned to the city council at the next regular meeting of the council after its passage shall become a law in like manner as if signed by the mayor or person acting as such f all procedures for adoption of ordinances and resolutions as set forth in fs   shall be adopted by this charter and should the state of florida legislature amend or adopt a new statute establishing procedures for adoption of ordinances and resolutions then the amended or new statute shall automatically be adopted by this the city of hialeah gardens charter state law reference minimum mandatory procedure for adoption of ordinances fs   the initiative a power to initiate ordinances the people shall have power at their option to propose ordinances including ordinances granting franchises or privileges and to adopt the same at the polls such power being known as the initiative a petition meeting the requirements hereinafter provided and requesting the city council to pass an ordinance therein set forth or designated shall be termed an initiative petition and shall be acted upon as hereinafter provided b preparation of initiative petition  affidavit of genuineness of signatures signatures of initiative petitions need not all be on one paper but the circulator of every such paper shall make an affidavit that each signature appended to the paper is the genuine signature of the person whose name it purports to be which affidavit shall be substantially in the following form state of florida   ss county of dade  ___________ being duly sworn deposes and says that he is the circulator of the foregoing petition paper containing _____ signatures and that the signatures appended thereto were made in his presence and are the signatures of the persons whose names they purport to be signed _____ subscribed and sworn to before me this _____ day of ________ 19___ _____ notary public with each signature shall be stated the place of residence of the signer giving the street number or other description sufficient to identify the place all such papers pertaining to any one measure shall have written or printed thereon the names and addresses of at least fifteen 15 registered voters who shall be officially regarded as filing the petition and shall constitute a committee of the petitions for the purposes hereinafter named all such papers shall be filed in the office of the city clerk as one instrument c filing of petitions within twenty 20 days after the filing of the petition the city clerk shall ascertain by examination the number of registered voters whose signatures are appended thereto and whether this number is at least ten percent 10% of the total number of the registered voters as shown by the city registration books and the city clerk shall attach to said petition a certificate showing the result of such examination if by the city clerks certificate of which notice in writing shall be given to one or more of the persons designated the petition is shown to be insufficient it may be amended within ten 10 days from the date of said certificate by filing supplementary petition papers with additional signatures the city clerk shall within ten 10 days after such amendments make examination of the amended petition and if the city clerks certificate shall show the same to be insufficient the clerk shall file the petition in the city clerks office and shall notify each member of the committee of that fact the final finding of the insufficiency of a petition shall not prejudice the filing of a new petition for the same purpose d submission of petition to city council if the petition shall be found to be sufficient the city clerk shall so certify and submit the proposed measure to the city council at its next meeting upon receiving the proposed measure the city council shall at once proceed to consider it and shall take final action thereon within thirty 30 days from the date it is filed with them e election on initiated measures if the city council shall fail to pass the proposed measure or shall pass it in a form different from that set forth in the petition then the measure shall be submitted by the city council to the vote of the electors at the next election occurring not less than thirty 30 days after the date of the final action by the city council and if no election is to be held within six 6 months from such date then the city council shall call a special election to be held not less than thirty 30 days nor more than fortyfive 45 days from such date when submitted the measure shall be in its original form f initiative ballots the ballots used when voting upon any such proposed measure shall state the title of the measure with a runoff statement of the substance thereof when a measure proposed by initiative petition is passed by the city council but not in its original form and is to be submitted to a vote of the electors the measure as passed by the city council shall not take effect until after such vote and if the measure so submitted be approved by a majority of electors voting thereon it shall thereupon become an ordinance of the city and the measure as passed by the city council shall be deemed repealed if a majority of the electors voting on any such measure shall vote in favor thereof it shall thereupon become an ordinance of the city and may not be overturned except by referendum g number of measures to be initiated any number of proposed measures may be voted upon at the same election in accordance with the provisions of this charter vacancies and filling vacancies a should a seat on the city council become vacant due to the death resignation or removal from office in any manner authorized by law the remaining unexpired term shall be filled by 1 if the unexpired term of office is less than one hundred eighty 180 days until the next runoff election the office shall be filled by appointment by the mayor approved by a majority vote of the city council at its next meeting 2 if the unexpired term of office is one hundred eighty 180 days or more until the next runoff election the office shall be filled by a special election 3 the special election if necessary shall be held not less than thirty 30 days nor more than sixty 60 days after such vacancy occurred 4 for the purpose of counting days after a vacancy the count shall start on the day of the death the day that the resignation is submitted to the city clerk or the day that the removal from office takes effect b any temporary vacancy of a seat on the city council created by suspension by virtue of a grand jury indictment shall be filled by 1 for the first thirty 30 days after the suspension no action shall be taken to fill the vacancy 2 after thirty 30 days at the next meeting of the city council the office shall be filled by a temporary appointment by the mayor approved by a majority vote of the city council 3 after one hundred eighty 180 days the office shall be declared vacant and the vacancy shall be filled as per paragraph a of this section 4 any person serving as a temporary appointee shall have all the duties and powers of a city council member 5 should the suspended official be acquitted or cleared of the charges contained in the indictment the official shall be restored to office if the term of office has not expired c should the office of mayor become vacant due to the death resignation or removal from office in any manner authorized by law the remaining unexpired term shall be filled by 1 if the unexpired term of office is less than one hundred eighty 180 days until the next runoff election the chairperson of the city council shall assume the office of mayor the vicechairperson shall then become the chairperson of the city council and the vacancy on the city council shall be filled as per paragraph a1 of this section 2 if the unexpired term of office is one hundred eighty 180 days or more until the next runoff election the chairperson of the city council shall become acting mayor along with retaining the duties of the chairperson of the city council until the office shall be filled by a special election 3 the special election if necessary shall be held not less than thirty 30 days nor more than sixty 60 days after such vacancy occurred 4 for the purpose of counting days after a vacancy the count shall start on the day of the death the day that the resignation is submitted to the city clerk or the day that the removal from office takes effect d any temporary vacancy of the office of mayor created by suspension by virtue of a grand jury indictment shall be filled by 1 for the first one hundred eighty 180 days the chairperson of the city council shall become acting mayor along with retaining the duties of the chairperson of the city council 2 after one hundred eighty 180 days the office of mayor shall be declared vacant and the vacancy shall be filled as per paragraph c1 or c2 of this section e should the suspended mayor be acquitted or cleared of the charges contained in the indictment the mayor shall be restored to office if the term of office has not expired referendum 3387 oath of office every elected officer of the city before entering the duties of office shall take and subscribe to the following oath before any judicial officer of the state of florida to be filed and kept in the office of the city clerk i do solemnly swear or affirm that i will support protect and defend the constitution and government of the united states and the state of florida and that i will in all faithfully perform the duties of title of office on which i am now about to enter so help me god state law reference oath fs  87605 article iv  financial footnotes  2  state law reference financial matters fs   et seq 21830 et seq fiscal year the fiscal year for the city shall commence on the first day of october of each calendar year and shall end on the thirtieth 30th day of september of the following year such fiscal year shall also constitute the budget and accounting year state law reference mandatory fiscal year fs   21833 preparation of budget the mayor shall be responsible for the preparation of an annual budget which shall contain estimates of contemplated revenues and expenditures for the ensuing fiscal year and which shall itemize separately the sums contemplated as revenues according to their respective sources and itemized as to contemplated expenditures in accordance with the offices departments divisions or other separable units as may be related to the administration of the financial affairs of the city the preparation of the annual budget shall further be in accordance with the uniform accounting system manual for the state of florida adoption of budget a the preliminary budget shall be prepared and presented to the council no later than the last day of july of each year the council shall hold a public hearing on the budget in accordance with state and county requirements at which time interested persons shall be given an opportunity to be heard the city clerk shall post a notice of the place and time of the public hearing copies of the proposed budget shall be available in the office of the city clerk for public inspection at the time of posting such notice b during such public hearing the council may insert new items or may increase decrease or delete any items in the budget c the budget shall be finally adopted by majority vote of the council no later than the last day of september of each year and the millage or rate of taxation necessary to pay all outstanding debts in the ensuing fiscal year shall be fixed according to the provisions of fs ch 200 upon adoption by ordinance the budget shall constitute an appropriation of the amounts set forth herein d transfer of funds or revisions which may be required to conduct the affairs of the city where unanticipated changes in revenues and expenses occur reasonably requiring a revision of the budget shall be adopted by resolution e a copy of the budget as finally adopted shall be certified by the city council and the budget so certified shall be filed for the use of all offices and departments of the city state law reference mandatory procedure for adoption of budget fs   independent audit prior to the end of each fiscal year the council shall designate a certified public accountant who shall make an independent audit of accounts and other evidences of financial transactions of the city government as of the end of the fiscal year and who shall submit a report to the council and to the state of florida as may be required by law state law reference requirement for annual audit fs  21832 article v  bonded indebtedness footnotes  3  state and credit or taxing power of the city nor shall the city issue bonds notes or obligations of any nature type or form which are backed in whole or in part by the full faith and credit or taxing power of the city unless issuance of such bonds has been approved by vote of the majority of the electors voting on the issuance of such bonds in a runoff election in any runoff or special election in which a bond issue appears the bond issue shall be called noticed and conducted and the results thereof determined and declared in a manner required by florida state law referendum 3387 special assessment all or any part of such costs for which the bonds were established including the reimbursement of any funds that the city used to pay any part thereof conditions for sale of bonds bonds approved as newspaper of runoff circulation in dade county which publication shall be made once a week for three consecutive weeks the sale shall be held on a date and time fixed in the advertisement not less than ten 10 days nor more than thirty 30 days from the date of the last publication such bonds shall be sold for such prices as the city council shall determine  provided the amount is not less than 96 percent of face value plus accrued interest if sold at private sale the bonds shall be sold for cash at not less than 96 percent of the face value plus accrued interest the interest and principal on such bonds shall be payable at some responsible bank or trust company designated by the city council the interest rate limitations on bond issues shall be provided by florida state law annual tax the city council shall levy an annual tax upon all the taxable property in the city of hialeah gardens sufficient to pay the principal of such bonds as they mature and interest on outstanding bonds days following its appointment together with the citys building inspector for the sole purpose of reviewing the citys comprehensive plan and to make written recommendation to the city council of any action they believe should be taken it shall further be mandatory that this planning board meet every six 6 months together with the citys building inspector or at any time deemed necessary this board office a the mayor shall serve for a term as provided in the charter article iii section 9b if for some reason the mayor shall not be able to complete his term in office the office of mayor shall be filled for the incompleted term in accordance with charter article iii section 15c2 b whenever a person has been elected and taken the oath of office of mayor he shall be required on termination of his term of office to present to the city council at the last regular meeting before expiration of his term of office a final accounting of any funds books records or any other matters or items belonging to the city which he had possession of as a result of such office the council shall if all is in order approve the final accounting thus allowing the person next assuming the office to be in reserved division 3  meetings and rules of procedure footnotes  4  charter reference rules of city council art iii  12 adoption of rules a it is necessary that every deliberative body be governed by rules of procedure in order that the will of a majority of its members may be determined and revealed in an orderly manner b the city council must have rules to promote the orderly and businesslike consideration of the questions which come before it for determination these rules shall determine the priority and manner of consideration of questions and will provide an orderly and methodical plan so that all business may receive proper consideration thus eliminating confusion and waste of time and effort c the city council has an inherent right to regulate its own procedure subject to provisions of the state constitution florida statutes the city charter or other controlling authority d are the rules of procedure and shall govern all meetings of the city council 01 copy of rules available the rules of procedure shall be made available for inspection by concerned parties at the city hall during normal business hours of city business 02 meetings a regular meetings the city council at its organizational meeting following the runoff election shall fix the day to hold regular meetings when the day fixed for any regular meeting falls on a day designated by law as a legal holiday the meeting may be held on the next succeeding day or may be canceled at the discretion of the city council regular meetings may be otherwise postponed or canceled by resolution or motion adopted at a regular meeting by a majority of the councilmembers present notice of the postponement or cancellation of any regular meeting shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation by the city clerk for at least one publication all regular meetings shall be held in the council chambers in city hall or at a place as approved by resolution or motion adopted at a regular meeting by a majority of the councilmembers present and shall be open to the public and all news media b special meetings a special meeting of the city council may be called by the mayor council chairperson or by a majority of the members of the council whenever a special meeting is called a notice in writing signed by the mayor the council chairperson or a majority of the members of the council shall be served on the city clerk the city clerk shall forthwith serve verbal and written notice on each member of the council the mayor and the city attorney stating the date hour and place of the meeting and the purpose for which the meeting is called no other business shall be transacted at such meeting at least 48 hours must elapse between the time the city clerk receives notice in writing of such meeting and the time the meeting is to be held c emergency meetings an emergency meeting of the city council may be called by the mayor or the council chairperson whenever in their opinion an emergency exists which requires immediate action by the city council whenever an emergency meeting is called the mayor or the council chairperson shall notify the city clerk who shall forthwith serve verbal telephone and written notice on each member of the city council the mayor and the city attorney such notice shall state the date hour and place of such meeting and the purpose for which it is called no other business shall be transacted at such meeting at least 24 hours shall elapse between the time the city clerk receives notice of such meeting and the time the meeting is to be held d notice requirements for special or emergency meetings  meetings open to public if after reasonable diligence it was impossible to give notice of a special or emergency meeting to each city councilmember the failure shall not affect the legality of the meeting if a quorum is in attendance the minutes of each special or emergency meeting shall show the manner and method by which notice of the special or emergency meeting was given to each member of the city council or shall show a waiver of notice all special or emergency meetings shall be open to the public and all news media anything to the contrary in this section notwithstanding notice of any special or emergency meeting of the city council shall be waived only by not less than a majority of the entire membership of the city council no special or emergency meeting shall be held unless notice is given in compliance with the provisions of this section or notice is waived by a majority of the entire membership of the city council meetings to facilitate the acting mayors consideration of issues before the council provided it shall always be the chairpersons responsibilities to preserve strict order and decorum at all meetings of the city council b a majority vote of the city councilmembers present shall govern and conclusively determine all questions of order not otherwise covered the presiding officer shall vote on all questions his name being called last the presiding officer shall be further permitted to offer any motion or resolution from the chair c in the absence of the chairperson or in the event of his inability to serve by reason of illness or accident the vicechairperson shall perform the duties and functions of the chairperson until his return to the city or recovery and resumption of duty 06 councilmember who intends to be absent from any council meeting shall notify the city clerk of the intended absence as soon as the member conveniently can do so 09 quorum  conflict of interest a a majority of the whole number of members of the city council shall constitute a quorum no ordinance resolution or motion shall be adopted by the city council without the affirmative vote of the majority of all the members present b a member of the city council who has a conflict of interest on a particular matter before the council shall comply with the provisions in fs  3a where applicable c if a quorum is not present within 30 minutes after the hour appointed for the meeting of the city council the chairperson the vicechairperson or in their absence the city clerk may adjourn the meeting until the next day unless by unanimous agreement those members present select another hour or day the names of the members present and their action at the meeting shall be recorded in the minutes by the city clerk 10 state law reference voting conflicts fs  3  order of business all meetings of the city council shall be open to the public promptly at the hour set for each meeting the members of the city council the city attorney the mayor and the city clerk shall take their regular stations in the meeting room and the business of the council shall be taken up for consideration and disposition in accordance with the agenda for the meeting 11 rules of debate a when a motion is presented and seconded it is under consideration by the council and no other motion shall be received thereafter except to adjourn to lay on the table to postpone or to amend until the question is decided these motions shall have preference in the order in which they are mentioned and the first two shall be decided without debate final action upon a pending motion may be deferred until a date certain by a majority of the councilmembers present b the chairperson the vicechairperson or other member of the council as may be presiding may move second and debate subject only to the limitations of debate as are by these rules imposed upon all councilmembers c every councilmember desiring to speak for any purpose shall address the presiding officer and upon recognition shall confine himself to the question under debate avoiding all personalities and indecorous language the consequences of a measure may be denounced in strong terms  but to attack the motives of those who propose or advocate it shall not be in order d a councilmember once recognized shall not be interrupted when speaking unless it is to call the member to order or as otherwise provided in this section if a member while speaking is called to order the member shall cease speaking until the question of order is determined by the presiding officer and if in order the member shall be permitted to proceed any member may appeal to the city council from the decision of the chairperson upon a question of order when without debate the chairperson shall submit to the council the question shall the decision of the chair be sustained the council shall decide such question by a majority vote e the councilmember moving the adoption of an ordinance or resolution shall have the privilege of closing the debate f upon any roll call there shall be no discussion by any member voting and he shall vote yes or no any member upon voting may give a brief statement to explain his vote a member shall have the privilege of filing with the city clerk a written explanation of his vote g an action of the city council may be reconsidered only at the same meeting at which the action was taken or at the next regular meeting thereafter a motion to reconsider may be made only by a member who voted on the prevailing side of the question and must be concurred in by a majority of those present at the meeting a motion to reconsider shall not be considered unless at least the same number of members are present as participated in the original vote under consideration or upon affirmative vote of twothirds of those members present adoption of a motion to reconsider shall rescind the action reconsidered h any member of the council may change his vote before the next item is called for consideration or before a recess or adjournment is called whichever occurs first but not thereafter i once action is taken on a proposed ordinance or resolution which action was by four votes neither the same matter nor its repeal or rescission may be brought before the city council again during the sixmonth period following such action subject to the provisions of subsection g of this section unless application by a majority of the councilmembers is first submitted to the mayor if an ordinance or resolution is proposed that raises the same previously resolved matter or its repeal or rescission in different or modified form during such sixmonth period the chairperson may declare the proposal out of order 12 reading of the minutes a unless a reading of the minutes of a meeting is requested by a majority of the city council the minutes when approved by the council and signed by the chairperson and the city clerk shall be considered approved without reading provided that the clerk shall have given each member of the council a copy the minutes of prior meetings may only be approved by a majority of the councilmembers present at a meeting of the council and upon approval shall become the official minutes b the minutes of each council meeting shall be corrected or amended informally the presiding officer directing the correction to be made when suggested but if objection is made the correction or amendment must be approved by the majority of the councilmembers present minutes of prior meetings may be corrected whenever the error is noticed regardless of the time which has elapsed and a majority vote of the councilmembers present is required for the adoption of the corrections or amendments even though the minutes have previously been approved and it is too late to reconsider that vote 13 voting on every roll call vote the surname of the city councilmember present shall be called by the jurisdiction of the council city councilmembers the mayor and the city clerk may place a citizen on the official agenda the deadline for placing a citizen on the agenda is noon on tuesday of the week preceding the week of the meeting at which the citizen wishes to be heard any citizen shall be entitled to speak on any matter appearing on the official agenda but only when recognized by the presiding officer and only on the subject matter under consideration at the time by the council b no citizen shall be permitted to address the council on any matter not appearing on the official agenda unless the council first grants permission to be heard by a twothirds vote of the entire council c each person other than a salaried member of the city who addresses the city council shall stand before the council and shall give the following information in an audible tone of voice for the minutes 1 such persons name 2 his address 3 whether he speaks for himself a group of persons or a third party if the person says that he represents an organization he shall also indicate the number of members in the organization the date of the most recent meeting of the organizations board or governing council and whether the views expressed by the speaker represent an established policy of the organization approved by the board or governing council 4 whether he is being compensated by the persons for whom he speaks 5 whether he or any member of his immediate family has a personal financial interest in the pending matter other than that set forth in subsection c4 of this section d unless further time is granted by the city council the citizen shall limit his address to five minutes all remarks shall be addressed to the council as a body and not to any member thereof no person other than councilmembers and the person having the floor shall be permitted to enter into any discussion either directly or member of the council without the permission of the presiding officer no shall have the right and power to suspend any of the officers or employees under his immediate command who may be under his management or control for incompetency common neglect of duty immorality drunkenness failure to obey orders given by proper authorities or for any other just or reasonable cause and shall forthwith certify the fact in writing together with the cause for suspension to the mayor g the mayor shall after review of the action taken by the chief of police under subsection f of this section render final judgment thereon which may be a reprimand fine suspension reduction in rank or removal and which shall be final further the mayor shall have the right with respect to the chief of police to suspend the chief of police for any of the causes for which the chief of police on public streets sidewalks parks and places  6 to preserve order at elections and all public meetings and assemblages  7 to regulate the movement of vehicles in the streets  8 to prevent the violation of all laws and ordinances in force applicable to the police department  and 9 to cause the immediate arrest and apprehension of any violators of the laws and ordinances i it shall be the canals and related facilities situated partially or entirely within the city which are from time to time designated by the mayor 2 develop plans and make recommendations for the establishment merger fees the public works department shall charge and collect fees for public works construction under permit issued by the public works department in canal road and street rightsofway and utility or other easements in the city area and in rightsofway of canals roads and streets located within the city drainage on private property such fees are on file in the city clerks office b penalty fees when work for which a permit required by this section is commenced prior to obtaining a permit a penalty fee will be imposed the payment of such penalty fee shall not relieve any person from fully complying with all of the requirements of all applicable regulations and codes nor shall it relieve such persons from any of the penalties therein c extension of permit a permit may be extended for a period of up to but not more than one year from the expiration date of the original permit provided the permit section of the public works department is notified prior to the expiration of the permit if the permit is allowed to expire without requesting an extension a new permit will be required including appropriate fees for the remainder of the uncompleted work  refund of permit fee a full or partial refunds may be granted to a permit holder whose permit is canceled by owner authorization where work has commenced and the owner selects a second contractor to complete the work the second contractor shall pay a full fee to complete the work unless the first contractor waives his opportunity to a refund in writing in which case the second contractor is entitled to a permit to cover the same work on prorated charge basis b no refunds will be made where any work has commenced as evidenced by any recorded inspections having been made by the department c no refunds will be made where construction was stopped by court order or permits canceled by same d where there is a change of contractor or qualifier involving a permit for which a fee of more than $7500 was paid to the department the following conditions shall prevail 1 the original permit holder a is not entitled to any refund if the permit has expired or if work as evidenced by any recorded inspection has commenced under such permit  or b is entitled to a full refund where the permit has not expired and no work as evidenced by any recorded inspection has commenced 2 the second permit holder a shall pay a full fee if the original permit has expired  b shall pay only $7500 to cover the cost of transferring information from first permit holder permit to the second  or c shall pay full fee plus $7500 to cover the costs of transferring information from the first permit holder permit to the second when work as evidenced by any recorded inspection has commenced under the original unexpired permit  lost and revised plans fee when plans for pavement drainage sidewalk driveway or any construction on rightofway are lost by the owner or contractor a recertification fee will be required to review stamp and approve a new set of plans as a field copy such fee shall be based on 15 percent of the original public work permit  reinspection fees when extra inspection trips are necessary due to the wrong address being given on call for inspections permit cards and plans not available for the inspector the prior rejection of work due to faulty construction work not being ready for inspections at the time specified failure to call for final or other inspections required corrections not being made or completed at the time specified or other code violation or special inspections a fee of $4000 for each reinspection may be charged the payment of reinspection fees may be required before any further permits will be issued to the person or firm owning same and further inspections may be refused until payment of reinspection fees have been made  exception a fee will be charged for each permit except when waived for governmental agencies  secs 21932210  reserved article v  code compliance reference department  7851 guidelines for code compliance department there is hereby established a code compliance department the city of hialeah gardens does hereby establish operational guidelines for the code compliance department these operational guidelines shall coincide with the statutes of the state of florida and in particular county or municipal  the intent of this division is to improve the health safety and welfare of the citizens of the city by providing an equitable expeditious effective method of enforcing the various codes that are pertinent to the city  inclusive of local business tax receipt fire prevention building land use minimum housing contractor sign and related technical codes this division also establishes the fines that correspond to the different types of violations the violation of any section of this well as a violation of any of the regulations set forth in section 22502 of this division shall constitute a civil offense punishable by civil penalty in the amount prescribed in section 22502  exh 1 2706   91608 federal and state authority the provisions of this not deprive any federal or state agency or any applicable governing authority having jurisdiction of any power or authority which it had on the effective date of the adoption of this division or of any remedy then existing for the enforcement of its orders nor shall it deprive any individual or corporation of its legal rights as provided by law  exh 1 2706 creation and establishment of the code compliance department there is hereby established a department to be called the code compliance department this department shall establish operational guidelines for the department the person in charge shall be known as the code compliance director  exh 1 2706 employee qualifications a director the code compliance director shall be appointed by the mayor the qualifications for this position are to be set by the mayor and reviewed periodically b officer the qualifications for code compliance officer will be set by the mayor and reviewed periodically  exh 1 2706 powers and duties a director the code compliance directors duties are to be designated by the position are to be designated by the mayor and reviewed periodically  exh 1 2706 right of entry whenever necessary to make an inspection to enforce any of the provisions of this or whenever any code compliance officer has reasonable cause to believe that there exists in any building or upon any premise any condition or code violation which makes such building structure commercial space business space vacant land unsafe dangerous or hazardous or holds an illegal business operation the code compliance officer may enter such building structure commercial space business space vacant land or premises at all reasonable times to inspect the same or to perform any action necessary to enforce or effectuate this provided that if such building or premises is occupied at the time heshe shall first present proper credentials to the occupant and request entry if such building structure or premises is unoccupied heshe shall first make a reasonable effort to locate the owner or other persons having charge or control of such and request entry if entry is refused the code compliance director shall have recourse to every recourse provided by law to secure entry  exh 1 2706 warrants when a any building structure or premises shall fail or neglect after proper request is made as herein provided to promptly permit entry to the code compliance officer for the purpose of inspection and examination pursuant to this  exh 1 2706 liability any code compliance officer or employee of the city charged with the enforcement of this acting for the city in the discharge of hisher duties shall not be personally liable and is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of hisher duties any suit brought against any city employee because of an act performed in the enforcement of any provision of this division or any other code adopted by the city shall be defended by the city until the final termination of the proceedings  exh 1 2706 civil offenses and penalties  hearing officers the violation of any section of the city constitute a civil offense punishable by civil form of administrative hearings and to consider evidence and issue orders therewith and in connection with the enforcement of city ordinances  exh 1 2706 appointment and qualification of officers  removal and organization a special master appointments shall be made by the mayor and city council on the basis of experience and interest in code compliance b the mayor and city council shall appoint as many special masters as are deemed necessary appointments shall be made for a term of one year and any reappointments are at the discretion of the mayor and city council there shall be no limit on the number of reappointments that may be given to any special master provided however that a determination as to removal or reappointment must be made for each hearing officer at the end of each of hisher oneyear terms the mayor or city council shall have the authority to remove special masters with or without cause appointments to fill any vacancy shall be for the remainder of the unexpired term c special masters shall be shall compensated by the code compliance department budget at the rate determined by the mayor and city council  exh 1 2706 enforcement procedures a a code compliance
